answer.explanation:
Tape scripts
M: Ms. Martin, Q2 I really think that the photos from the weekend rugby match should be included in this weekend’s sports section.
W: Out readers prefer golf and football, so I usually include those sports instead.
M: I understand, but we need to differentiate ourselves from other papers. Why don’t we try offering something different?
W: I don’t think many at our readers are rugby fans, but I’ll talk it over with Josh and consider it.

question.text: Where do the speakers most likely work?
What would the man like to do?
What does the woman say about rugby?
choices: A. Josh is a big fan of the sport
B. It is growing in popularity
C. It is difficult to play
D. Not many people like it

answer.text: D. Not many people like it

answer.explanation:
M: Q1 Thanks for choosing our career coaching service, Ms. Reynolds. Why don’t you start by telling me a little bit about your current career and your future goals?
W: Well, after I graduated, Q2 I started working in the insurance industry, but now I’d like to look into the possibility of going to law school. Do you think it’s too late to start on this new path?
M: Oh, not really. In fact, Q3 I can refer you to a former coworker who went to law school after a decade of working here. Let me put you in touch with him, so you can ask about his career change.

question.text: Who most likely is the man?
What is the woman thinking of doing?
What does the man suggest the woman do?

answer.explanation:
Tape scripts
W: Well. Robert. I thought you were out visiting clients this afternoon.
M: Mr. Reid asked me to cancel the meeting; we’re really short staffed in the office today. This is why I feel that they should hire more people so that we’re not heavily burdened with this work to finish! Don’t you think so?
W: Yeah. I absolutely agree with you. Q2 But you know that our company’s sales have been going down and down. They can’t afford to hire any more. We’re lucky that we’re not one of those who were laid off.
M: Yeah. You’re right. Q3 I should be grateful for even just having a job these days.

question.text: Why has Robert’s plan changed?
choices: A. Robert's clients canceled the meeting.
B. His help is needed in the office.
C. Someone else other than Robert wanted to go.
D. He had to help move the office.

answer.text: B. His help is needed in the office.

question.text: What can you tell about the situation the company is in?
choices: A. Their sales rates have been increasing.
B. Their sales rates have been doubling.
C. The president has been laying lots of people off.
D. Their sales rates have been constant.

answer.text: C. The president has been laying lots of people off.

question.text: Why should Robert be thankful?
choices: A. He is still working for the company.
B. He is getting paid more starting next week.
C. He has another meeting with clients next month.
D. He is getting scouted by other companies.

answer.text: A. He is still working for the company.

answer.explanation:
W: Q1&2 The board of directors asked for some adjustments to the budget proposal for next year because the cost of fuel has increased so much.
M: Well, Q3 we’re sending the annual report to the printer on Thursday. Will the new proposal be ready by then?
W: Yes. I had Jade in accounting check the figures on Monday, so I can send the revision over to you this afternoon.
M: OK. Then once I look over the statement from the board, we should be all set.

question.text: Who requested the changes in the budget proposal?
Why was it necessary to change the budget proposal?
When will the annual report be sent to the printer?

answer.explanation:
M: Hello, Q1 I’m calling about the laptop I bought at your store a few weeks ago. It’s been running very slowly, and I’m afraid it may have a virus. I know the computer is covered by warranty, so I want to bring it in.
W: Unfortunately, our warranty only covers defective parts. Q2 It won’t cover the problem you’re having with the computer virus.
M: Well, I’d still like to bring in the laptop for Service, even if there’s a charge. Can I do that anytime I like, or should I make an appointment?
W: That won’t be necessary, but Q3 I’d recommend coming in early. That way, you won’t have to wait. And, depending on how complicated the problem is, we may even be able to fix it immediately.

question.text: What type of business is the man calling?
What does the woman say about the warranty?
choices: (D) It does not cover the needed repair.

answer.text: (D) It does not cover the needed repair.

question.text: What does the woman recommend?

answer.explanation:
Tape scripts
M: Ms. Lee, I’m calling to let you know about the results of the interview you had with us on Monday. Q1 I’ve gotten the word from my boss that the position is yours if you’re still interested.
W: Are you kidding? I mean, of course I am still interested.
M: That’s great. When do you think you will be able to start your new position? Is next Monday okay?
W: I’m sorry, Q2 but I have not had a chance to inform my current boss about my quitting here, Q3 and I think I have to give him two-week’s notice to find a replacement. How about the first of June?

question.text: What is the purpose of the man’s call?
choices: A. To notify the woman of a test result.
B. To see if the woman would be interested in the job.
C. To ask the woman some questions about work
D. To tell the woman that he might be leaving his job.

answer.text: B. To see if the woman would be interested in the job.

question.text: What does the woman say she has to do?
choices: A. Notify her manager about her quitting her job.
B. Inform the candidate about the results of his job interview.
C. Ask the candidate how soon he can start his new position.
D. Tell her boss about the interview set for the day.

answer.text: A. Notify her manager about her quitting her job.

question.text: When does Ms. Lee say she will be available to start?

answer.explanation:
W: Hi. I just opened a hair salon, and Q1 I’m calling to order some business cards. Is there someone at your store who can help me?
M: Well, unless you want some specific artwork on the card, Q2 I suggest that you go to our web site and order the cards online. It’s a very easy process, and we have a number of styles to choose from.
W: Actually, Q3 I’d like to have one of your employees create a company logo for the card.
M: Q3 OK. I’ll let you talk with Bill, then. He’s our graphic designer. He can help you with that.

question.text: What does the woman want to do?
What does the man suggest doing?
Why does the man recommend that the woman talk to Bill?

answer.explanation:
W: Q1 Has the sink in lab 2 been repaired yet?
M: No. Q2 I talked to the plumber yesterday, and he said he wouldn’t get here to fix it until Friday.
W: But it’s only Tuesday! What are we supposed to do in the meantime?
M: I think Q3 we can shift some of the test work into labs 1 and 4 if we need to. The space will be tight with the extra workers, but at least we can run all the scheduled analyses.

question.text: Who most likely are the speakers?
What problem are the speakers discussing?
What will the speakers probably do next?

answer.explanation:
Tape scripts
W: Have we employed a new caterer in Q1 the company cafeteria?
M: Yes, and I really think there’s a big improvement in the variety of the food.
W: I agree. I was definitely ready for a change. Q2 I also liked that the location was moved to the main floor. It’s much more convenient for me.
M: Q3 It’s much more affordable as well.

question.text: What are the speakers talking about?
What has the cafeteria changed?
What did the man say about the cafeteria?
choices: A. The menu is too limited
B. The caterer is very experienced
D. The service isn’t very good

answer.explanation:
W: This is Eva Flores. I’ve been a patient of Dr. Morgan’s for some time now, but I’ll be moving to Boston for my work. Q1 I’m calling to see if I can get a copy of my medical records to take with me.
M; You could, Q2 but our usual policy is to transfer patient records directly to the doctor. Do you have a phone number for your new medical office? I could call there and arrange to send the records.
W: I don’t know yet who my new doctor will be. Would it be a problem if you have to keep my files for a while? I’ll let you know as soon as I know who I’ll be seeing.
MB: No, that’s no problem at all. But first, Q3 you’ll have to sign a form giving us your permission. You’re required to do that before we can send any information.

question.text: What are the speakers discussing?
What information does the man request?
What will the woman be required to do?
